item.title: Report X-2024021191
item.description:
Report X-2024021191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, the cap was found loose allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote. Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

DescribePack: Drum was being rts. Drum was dropped from conveyor belt causing the drum to get dented and some small puncture holes to happen, allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Placed upside down so the puncture holes are facing up.

item.description:
Report X-2024021445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: VANDALIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was found on the end of trailer when unload opened the door. Hazmat box was wet. QA was immediately called about the package. Package was placed in a hazmat drum by QA and inspected. It was found 1 of the 4 jerricans had a loose lid and had leaked contents. DescribePack: Lid on the 1 gallon jerrican was loose. Leaking was a very slow drip. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed in hazmat drum and lid was attempted to be screwed back on.

item.title: Report E-2024020494
item.description:
Report E-2024020494

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that eighteen (18) ounces of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum and spent absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020476
item.description:
Report E-2024020476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 14, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican of hydrogen peroxide was damaged in a load shift and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. Crews deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and dock surface. FCE personnel worked the granular absorbents in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All hydrogen peroxide impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2024020064
item.description:
Report E-2024020064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/01/2024, at 0900 hours, personnel in the CSXT Collinwood Yard discovered MJEX 73527, a loaded tank car of Methyl Isobutyl Carbinol, leaking from the manway area. The car was isolated and The Shipper, Altivia, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-0201-00063). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the product leaking from the liquid line valve mounting flange as a result of the mounting flange bolts being less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the flange bolts to stop the release. The issue identified and corrective action were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Timothy Albert, 740-533-5200). The car was held out of transportation pending further repair/qualification by a certified mobile repair unit or One Time Movement Approval (OTMA) from FRA.

item.title: Report E-2024020479
item.description:
Report E-2024020479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 15, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon bottle of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, FCE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3266 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste

  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was found during the unload process on 1-30 at 21:30 and taken to qa for inspection. DescribePack: carton was wet due to a leaking plastic bag inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe used to place carton in a hazmat bag and then into a plastic tote.
